Package kdl.prox.nsi2.nsi

Interface Summary
NSI The NSI interface is where our intelligence lies: it provides smart ways of estimating distances between a pair of nodes in the graph.
 

Class Summary
APSPNSI The All Pairs Shortest Path NSI stores the exact graph distance for all pairs of nodes.
DegreeNSI The Degree NSI labels each node with its degree.
DTZNSI The DTZ NSI, or distance-to-zone, computes a Zone NSI and then for each node, stores the shortest distance to each other zone.
GNPNSI The GNP NSI is based on the Global Network Positioning system proposed by Ng & Zhang in 2002.
LandmarksNSI The Landmarks NSI chooses a set of landmarks and stores the exact distance from every node to each landmark.
MatrixFactorizationNSI The Matrix Factorization NSI is based on techniques proposed by Mao & Saul in 2004.
SearchNSI The Search NSI uses a searching routine to provide distances.
ZoneNSI The Zone NSI works by assigning each node a label corresponding to one of k zones The zones are chosen by randomly flooding from k seed nodes until all nodes have been labeled.
